intro: Mibora maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan mibora, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Mibora maroccana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
